Reviews.Title: “Very Small, Very Stylish & Very Well Run!”
Reviews.Author: ZipsterM
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews in TripAdvisor, we booked this room on SkyAuction.com. WOW! is all I can say. ALL the staff were wonderful, and oh so helpful. The room is what you see, that's what you get (but no bath tub) and breakfast is included. The only caution is walking up those 9th Arr. hills.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for Louis Armstrong!”
Reviews.Author: GeriSydney
Reviews.Content: Finding an hotel room in Paris during fashion week wasn't easy. I stumbled on the last room at the Alba Opera Hotel in an area of Paris I didn't know well. It is in the 9th but at the very top. Only a short walk away from the restaurants and fashion shops of Montmartre. Situated in a small cul de sac the outlook from our room was very "French". The room size was enormous. Big bathroom as well.(For Paris) We had our own kitchen equipped with a small fridge, microwave & sink. The owners have only been there for 3 years and are on a quest to make this hotel their "own". Lovely interior courtyard perfect for an afternoon aperitif. A wee bit tired in the corridors but it's the corridor so who cares? Wrought iron lift that I don't think Louis would have fitted in!!! Quirky deco. Feathered light fittings and the odd sighting of Barbie and Batman. I think it was fun & staff very kind & helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A humourous Nicolas and his courteous Parisien friends make you feel at home”
Reviews.Author: YewFatt
Reviews.Content: Hotel with contemporary design housed in a historical building. 75 year elevator adds to the charming atmosphere. Very Big and Clean Rooms. Real Spacious, unusual for Paris ! Its hard to find, secluded. But peaceful at night. Safe. No one around but the guests and residents. Surrounded by 4 metro stops. I miss Nicolas. He's so funny. He thinks he is Japanese and he listens to Cantonese songs. I'm glad I chose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely brilliant service and location - PERFECT!!!”
Reviews.Author: AmyBorro
Reviews.Content: ok, so i consider myself to be a little bit of a snob when it comes to hotels, in the sense that i like everything to be clean and look pretty. So if money would allow it, i will always stay in as-high-a-star rated hotel as possible. With planning a wedding, we were sticking to quite a strict budget on our trip to Paris. i tend to establish my price range and then figure out which hotel has the best reviews and go for that one. That's what i did with the Alba Opera. I wasn't blown away from the pictures and i could tell it def. wasn't a five star hotel by any stretch of the imagination. But upon arrival until we left, i was incredibly impressed with how the staff treated their customers. Yes the hotel wasn't particularly modern and could do with a bit of a revamp / spruce up but i really felt like everything that the staff had immediate control over, was perfect. They were incredibly courteous, kind and friendly. They offered great advice; Whenever we go to a new place, we like to ask the locals for the best places to eat etc and every recommendation that was provided by the staff came up trumps. Some say the breakfast was a little overpriced, and perhaps it was compared to going to a Boulangerie, but breakfast fast became my favourite meal of the day. The food was very fresh and plentiful. They would give you extra items upon request at no extra charge. They also said to us that we could have breakfast whenever we wanted to and that if we wanted it in our room, they would be happy to bring it to us. The location of the hotel was fantastic and it had a great little boutiquey feel. There's one tiny tiny lift that will take you to all the floors but this isn't big enough if you were in a wheelchair for instance. As the hotel was located just up a side street, it was very quiet at night. Overall, the room was very clean with fresh linens. The room did smell a little bit stale (i'm assuming it used to be a smoking room) but with everything else really impressing me, this was a non-factor. the free WIFI was an added a bonus :-) I would def. recommend as a pleasant place to stay when in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: GolferWC
Reviews.Content: The rooms were not what we expected for a 3 star hotel, but I think our standards may be too high based on what we're used to in the U.S. The rooms were clean, small and dated. The bed was okay, not the most comfortable bed. The service was very nice and helpful. They gave us a great recommendation for dinner at the Cul de Poule right around the corner. The breakfast was quite good, but does cost an extra 10 euro per person, not a great deal. Overall, we would stay again because of the great location and service and cleanliness. Also check out the Thai House right around the corner. We found it on Yelp and it was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, great value...”
Reviews.Author: JodieHatley1
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through myparis.co.uk and we got an extremely good price for 5 nights in this hotel. It is in an excellent location, close to many metro stations and in walking distance to the sacre couer and also the moulin rouge - the pigalle area isn't as dodgy as we had anticipated, we felt safe walking through there at 1am. The metro is by far the best way to get around, cheap and very efficient. The room was quite small but it had everything we needed, especially the safe and tv! The staff were lovely, very friendly and helpful, and were there to recommend places to eat nearby. The rooms were cleaned every day, and breakfast was also great, very filling! All in all, I couldn't fault this hotel, and would definitely stay there again and recommend it to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “AUTHENTIC PARISIEN CHARM”
Reviews.Author: tgord
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location with 4 metro stations walking distance to the hotel. The staff were beyond lovely and really wanted us to make the most of our short break. They helped us make restaurant reservations and directed us to the best streets to shop and have lunch. Breakfast was typically french with croissants and baguettes with assorted jams- and they do a delicious hot chocolate Decor is dated and there aren't really any "mod cons" but they do offer free wi fi. We loved it's charm and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Made my stay in Paris Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: SpaGirl85
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because it was basically one of the last available on the weekend I was in Paris, due to the Bank Holiday weekend. I am so glad I found this as it was Perfect, and I would recommend anyone to stay there, as I will be there again! The location is perfect, very close walking to Moulin Rouge, Sacre Cour, Pigalle station and beautiful cafes/restaurants. When we arrived the lady on reception was lovely, and was expecting us, offered to show us where we are and any assistance we needed (such as room service, laundry, basically anything we wanted she could get us). My partner and I had a room with a small kitchen, bathroom and dbl bedroom with a balcony overlooking the street which was very cute. The room was very clean, all that you could fault is that the carpet was old, but who cares?! We paid 125 Euro per night including breakfast which consisted of a baguette, choc croissant, croissant, tea and juice. Very nice!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Recommended !!!”
Reviews.Author: BiserDimitrov
Reviews.Content: We went to Paris for 3 nights and stayed at Alba Opera Hotel. We were surprised of the big rooms and the service offered. The hotel is easy to reach from the Pigale station. The staff is helpful and helped us with guidance how to get to certain parts of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely atmospheric Parisienne hotel”
Reviews.Author: TauntonHeadGardener
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 5 nights here. We read the reviews, so were prepared for the worn carpets and tired decor. But love the atmosphere. For a city hotel, very quiet (except the bin collections at about 6 on Friday mornings)! No clock available. Kitchenette wasn't quite what we expected, the microwave is very high on the wall. You pay 3 Euros for kitchen pack (2 plates, mugs, tumblers and wine glasses + basic cutlery) No pans - but we didn't ask. You'll need to take your own coffee/tea etc, as none is provided. It was nice to have the extra room to sit in if one wakes earlier than the other (and drink tea of course). Ended up eating out (tres cher!!) at lovely nearby restaurants, but at least we had the choice. The beds were comfortable - no duvets here. Loved the lift, but as we were only on first floor,didn't use it. Bath lovely, with over the taps shower which was extremely powerful, if a little leaky. Yes, you can hear others up and down stairs, but not boom, boom, boom of loud music!! We didn't have the breakfast, so can't comment on the dining room - but McCafe is nearby (towards Cadet metro station) and has offer of pastry + drink for 1.80 euros, which has to be a record. Would recommend the Auberge du Clou just around the corner (turn right out of the hotel road and right onto Rue de Martyrs and it's at the top facing you. About 5 mins walk). Lovely food, very friendly atmosphere. The Fuxia on R.de Martyrs is also good Italian. All food and drink in Paris is pricey, so be prepared. Outside the Louvre, a large beer and mint tea was 14 Euros!!! Transport is easy - nearby you have several metro stations, which are easier to navigate than the buses, and more frequent. Do go to the Latin Quarter, and sit outside the coffee shop in front of the Sorbonne - it's lovely surrounded by all sorts of different people, not just tourists. And the Jardin des Plantes has lovely places to sit (and it's free). The Eiffel Tower will often be a long wait (sometimes hours), so start early. Have a good holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Feeling at home...”
Reviews.Author: A_Brazilian_Family
Reviews.Content: Well located, although the name "ópera" could mislead you about the site of the hotel; it is a trully Pigalle lodging, but well served of transport and amenities; you can store and cook small meals yourself! The staff is most friendly and always trying to help. If you want to visit Paris, be confort, but without spending your precious euros, that´s a place to be!

Reviews.Title: “Our new favourite Parisian hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mikel47
Reviews.Content: My 16 year old daughter chose this hotel because of its close proximity to the La Cigale. Great little hotel with super friendly and helpful staff. Our room, on the 6th floor was clean light and spacious. The lift, as mentioned in other reviews, is tiny - like from an old film - we liked it! Breakfast was excellent and the prices for room service are very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for Paris”
Reviews.Author: cathalr_99
Reviews.Content: Small, friendly hotel. Clean-ish rooms, if a little dated. Excellent location between 2 metro lines, nearest is Anvers about 7/8 mins walk. Nice, if basic, breakfast, friendly staff. Rooms not tiny by Parisian standards. Kitchenette with each of the rooms we occupied. One criticism: tiny, tiny lift, and with a large family plus bags there were many journeys up and down. Cant really comment much on the value, its all relative, but overall, for Paris, this wasnt too bad.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel in a great location with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: starfish555
Reviews.Content: I've just got back from spending 3 nights at the Alba Opera. I could not find any fault. I love the location, (a peaceful, elegant haven between two bustling districts). The rooms were very comfortable and a decent size, the staff were warm, friendly and attentive. I highly recommend the Alba Opera.

Reviews.Title: “Very chic communal areas in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Rikkard
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in July 2009. The hotel is tucked away down a courtyard in a quiet area near the monmatre, the decor is very modern and 'arty' in the lounge and reception, though a little shabby in the rooms. Rooms are large by Paris standards, though could have done with a fan or air con if we were being fussy as it was very warm when we arrived (approx 25'C) - though the fridge/freezer and free safe were a big bonus. Definitley in the Monmatre district rather than the opera district though close enough to walk to either, and around a 10 minute walk to the nearest metro (Pigalle). The Pigalle/Moulin Rouge area is very seedy and best avoided on an evening, though further up the hill there a hundreds of nice bustling cafes/restaurants - and one called the 'Zebra' (rue le pic) is well worth a visit for reasonabley priced gorgeous French food. There is a bar just as you come out of the hotel and turn right called Oscar's lounge, which is a quiet, local friendly bar worth a visit in the very reasonable happy hour (5pm - 9pm). I would come back to the alba again, the staff are friendly amd appreciate you atleast trying to speak French to them. Overall a 4/5 (though its not in the Opera District)

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel and excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: cathsmith38
Reviews.Content: We searched endlessly for the right hotel and eventually settled on this one. We were so deligthed with it as well. Its on a quiet side street, so no traffic noise. Our room was gorgeous - far bigger than expected and had a little balcony and kitchen area. The building is beautiful and typically parisienne although the lift (whilst gorgeous) is not for the claustrophobic - only fits two people side by side and thats a squeeze. Can feel a little hazardous! The staff were extremely nice and helpful (although the night porter was a little overly nice and nearly earned himself a smack in the mouth - beware female travellers) The breakfast was simple - bread, croissants, jam etc - and served in your room if requested. Very close to Monmatre and Sacre Coer, close to the Opera and within walking distance of bars and resteraunts. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great... Paris-chic Hotel ! Very nice people, decoration, etc...”
Reviews.Author: sttropezfriend
Reviews.Content: I just stayed there 2 nights in a row and really regretted that I couldn't stay any longer... The hotel is nice, the location is great, it's quiet... The people who manage the place are really pleasant and helpful.... The drinks are cheap (1,5e an espresso, 2 euros for a coke)... It's a lovely place if you wanna visit Paris... It's not really a Boutique Hotel... It's more a place with a soul, and some great decorative ideas. If you like the "post-card Paris"... Just go for it !!!!

Reviews.Title: “A gem............”
Reviews.Author: eccossaises
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. We chose the area as being between Opera and Monmartre - and it was. Metro's about 5 mins walk, buses close by and it was at the bottom of the hill up to Monmartre. It is tucked away in a sidestreet in a busy area away from traffic and street noise. Currently being modernised by its delightful owners but as it is just now -spotlessly clean and very comfortable and welcoming. Very traditionally Parisienne in that the building crams a lot into a small space (the two person lift is fascinating and fabulous). We had one of the smaller rooms but, even still, more floor space than in other Paris hotels we have stayed in - a reasonable sized double room, a shower room and a small kitchen which were all clean and well kept. The staff were all really nice people (including the two owners who have only recently taken over ) who spoke better English than our French, and were always helpful and friendly. Plans to extend the foyer and the enclosed courtyard at the back sound really interesting and we hope to go back to see how it looks when completed. Not flash - not formulaic - as it is clean, comfortable, friendly and with the potential to be even better in the near future. The ghost of Louis Armstrong ( who apparently stayed 2 rooms away from ours) did not play for us but we will be back to giver him another chance the next time we stay in Paris. If you are looking for something typically Parisienne and friendly in this area this is the hotel for you.

HotelInfo.Name: Alba Opera Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 34 ter, rue de La Tour d'Auvergne | 9th Arr., 75009 Paris, France
